descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this course, students will be introduced to traditional small-crew documentary filmmaking through the process of directing their own short 6 - 8 minute project. Students will get hands-on experience shooting, interviewing, recording sound and editing. Topics will include audience engagement, documentary innovation, and ethics.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class time will be divided between watching and critiquing peer generated work, guest filmmaker visits and screenings/discussions of influential documentary films. By speaking with filmmakers and viewing documentaries by a range of directors, students will wrestle with: What kinds of documentaries are relevant today? What are the ethical obligations of a documentarian? What is the relationship between method, style and story?

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: A series of written exercises, a project proposal, an on-camera interview, a rough cut, and a finished 6-8 minute documentary.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Textbook TBD, not to exceed $75. Additional handouts will be distributed in class or posted on Canvas.You will need to purchase a 1 to 2 TB hard drive (specs to be discussed in class).
